content: every round until it covers y our thumb k2tog around until 6 stitches remain break yarn weave through re maining stitches cinch and weave in ends we can learn a lot about teamwork and cooperation from geese flying in v-formation the lead goose uses the most energy because it is the first to break up the flow of air to give additional lift to the geese behind when the lead goose gets tired it goes to the back of the v where the wind is lightest and another goose moves to the front to take it s turn in the most difficult spot by flying together and rotating responsibility the whole flock travels 70% farther than each goose flying alone we are better together be like geese ©2021 darn knit anyway all rights reserved you are allowed to make a copy of this pattern for personal use only in whole or part editing and using the pattern as the basis for another pattern or as a template publishing transmitting emailing this pattern to others or posting online in whole or part is strictly prohibited darnknitanyway com 651 342 1386
